page.title: 08ENTERTAINMENT:WOODTON AREA
page.content: The parishes have a busy social life, e.g.the 160-strong Bingo club,which gives the profits from its weekly sessions to Woodton{Village Hall}& the Old People's annual party.The weekly Whist Drive,which attracts 80 members, who also support various charities,& a flourishing Conservative Association. There is a busy W.I.,a Jubilee Club _ a left-over from the Silver Jubilee celebrations _ a Homely Club providing fortnightly meetings for the over-60s & an aerobics class.Seething has its Flying Club.The clubs,with other groups,provide stalls & side-shows at the Village Hall Fete _ opened in 1985 by Norwich's Woodton-born Lady Mayor _ & at the School Fete,at which they also decorate & man processional floats.The 1984 pantomime,written, produced & performed by locals,was a huge success.
